oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Saturation in random graphs
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Korándi, Dániel
Sudakov, Benny
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Combinatorics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A graph $H$ is $K_s$-saturated if it is a maximal $K_s$-free graph, i.e., $H$ contains no clique on $s$ vertices, but the addition of any missing edge creates one. The minimum number of edges in a $K_s$-saturated graph was determined over 50 years ago by Zykov and independently by Erd\H{o}s, Hajnal and Moon. In this paper, we study the random analog of this problem: minimizing the number of edges in a maximal $K_s$-free subgraph of the Erd\H{o}s-R\'enyi random graph $G(n,p)$. We give asymptotically tight estimates on this minimum, and also provide exact bounds for the related notion of weak saturation in random graphs. Our results reveal some surprising behavior of these parameters.
Comment: 13 pages, 2 figures; some minor corrections
